LAW

Of course, nearly every author formulates law at least a little differently. Nonetheless, there are a few helpful and identifiable divisions in the literature.

Predictive Theory of Law

Oliver Wendell Holmes jr. describes this theory of law in Holmes, The Path of the Law in which he says that “the primary rights and duties with which jurisprudence busies itself again are nothing but prophecies.“

Things That I Don't Have Words For

Thompson and Holmes agree in opposition to a few legal fictions – that the law does not have some sort of necessary logic imbued in it.
